name: Parrot Security OS
description: Parrot Security OS is a Debian-based Linux distribution designed for security experts, developers, and privacy-conscious users. It includes tools for penetration testing, forensics, and secure browsing.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Parrot OS was launched in 2013 by the Frozenbox team, aiming to provide a lightweight, secure, and privacy-oriented operating system.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Parrot evolved to include a full suite of tools for ethical hacking, cryptography, programming, and anonymous internet usage via Tor and Anonsurf.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Today, Parrot Security OS is a popular choice among penetration testers and security researchers, offering both Security and Home editions for various use cases.

sections.title: Privacy & Security Toolkit
sections.text: Parrot emphasizes secure development and browsing environments, providing sandboxing, anonymity tools, and strong encryption by default.
